greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Continued fraction for e^(Pi*sqrt(163)).
comment: The real number e^(pi*sqrt(163)) ~ a(0)+1-1/a(2) (cf also the Example section) is called Ramanujan's constant: See the main entry A060295 for further information. - _M. F. Hasler_, Jan 26 2014
reference: Flajolet, Philippe, and Brigitte Vallée. "Continued fractions, comparison algorithms, and fine structure constants." Constructive, Experimental, and Nonlinear Analysis 27 (2000): 53-82. See Fig. 3.
H. M. Stark, An Introduction to Number Theory. Markham, Chicago, 1970, p. 179.
link: Ivan Panchenko, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
program: (PARI) default(realprecision,99);contfrac(exp(Pi*sqrt(163))) \\ With standard precision (38 digits), contfrac() returns only [a(0)+1]. - _M. F. Hasler_, Jan 26 2014
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 07 2000
